intro: Tribulus affinis, commonly known as goldenhead, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellowish-green leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Tribulus affinis is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
